item.title: RSCD v25
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

On another topic

K09, I was able to connect using a differen’t pc then the server was on, any other ideas of what may be wrong?

I still think you’ve got a firewall blocking ext connections. Firewalls tend to allow packets if the destination is on the LAN.

If you install teamviewer I’ll have a look sometime

Read full topic

item.title: RSCD v25
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

[quote=“Ecko, post:14, topic:242599”][quote author=KO9 link=topic=318926.msg2538627#msg2538627 date=1226872350]

adu: Why the fuck are you telling him to open port 80? As I already stated setting it as “0.0.0.0” will bind it to ALL interfaces (127.0.0.1, 192.168.x.x and any other NICs if he has them.)

black:can you connect from another PC on your LAN?

If he is connecting from the same PC that his server is running on, then you can’t use 0.0.0.0 because no data is being transferred across the router. There is no reroute.

Also, listening for data on 0.0.0.0 can leave you very vulnerable. IE- spoofing a source header (to be 0.0.0.0) and ping attacking.

Why are you trying to make it look like you know what you’re talking about?

Of course you can connect to localhost if you’ve set the bind addr as 0.0.0.0 and wtf are you talking about spoofing the src header… Clue up and don’t try and act like you know what you’re talking about, when you clearly don’t.
[/quote]

You can connect, but I don’t know why you would even allow all types of IP’s to connect to your network.

There’s an easier solution than the one KO9 is suggesting, and does not make your network less secure. He obviously doesn’t know much about smurf spoofing and using 0.0.0.0 as a Denial of Service attack.[/quote]

Sorry let me go put my 8 years of practical TCP/IP networking experience in the bin and I’ll let you handle this one. K?

Read full topic

item.title: RSCD v25
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

[quote=“blacknight666, post:3, topic:242616”]so how do I connect on the client, doesen’t let me connect using my External IP, only Private IP & 127.0.0.1

Adu: I tried what you posted there, it worked but you can only connect on the client using your private IP(192.168.xx.xx).[/quote]

That is the stuff you need to put in world.xml and ls.conf. Now your settings.ini folder should have your “external” ip address. If you still cant connect you gotta port forward if your using a router or see if your firewall is blocking any incoming traffic.

Read full topic

item.title: RSCD v25
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

Change your World.xml to this:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
<!DOCTYPE properties SYSTEM "http://java.sun.com/dtd/properties.dtd">
<properties>
	<comment>RSCD Config</comment>
	<entry key="version">31</entry>
	<entry key="ip">0.0.0.0</entry>
	<entry key="port">43594</entry>
	<entry key="name">RSCDaemon</entry>
	<entry key="location">Scotland</entry>
	<entry key="maxplayers">800</entry>
	<entry key="servernum">30</entry>
	<entry key="lsip">localhost</entry>
	<entry key="lsport">34522</entry>
</properties>

Read full topic
